Pre-Game Insights: Sunil Chhetri announced his retirement, making the match on June 6, 2024, his last game for India.
India head coach Igor Stimac emphasized the importance of victory over Kuwait and stated that the team is ready for the match.
India and Kuwait have met thrice in the last 12 months, with India winning one of those encounters.
Scoring goals from open play has been a challenge for India, with their last open-play goal against Kuwait coming from Manvir Singh.
Kuwait held a one-week camp in Bangkok before traveling to Kolkata for the match.
Kuwait's head coach Rui Bento expressed confidence in his team's preparation and readiness to face India.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match will be broadcast on Sports 18 1, Sports 18 1 HD, Sports 18 3, and streamed live on JioCinema on June 6, 2024, at 19:00 IST.
